turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Slot machine.
turn.1: What is the psychology of playing slot machines?
turn.2: Parlor operators naturally set most machines to simply collect money, but intentionally place a few paying machines on the floor so that there will be at least someone winning, encouraging players on the losing machines to keep gambling, using the psychology of the gambler's fallacy.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: Despite the many varieties of pachislot machines, there are certain rules and regulations put forward by the , an affiliate of the National Police Agency.
turn.5: What are some of the rules?
turn.6: For example, there must be three reels.
turn.7: Can you tell me more of the rules?
turn.8: All reels must be accompanied by buttons which allow players to manually stop them, reels may not spin faster than 80 RPM, and reels must stop within 0.19 seconds of a button press.
turn.10: In practice, this means that machines cannot let reels slip more than 4 symbols.
turn.11: Is that all of the rules?
turn.12: Other rules include a 15 coin payout cap, a 50 credit cap on machines, a 3 coin maximum bet, and other such regulations.
